gurmukhi: mwnsr hMs swDsMgiq prmhMs DrmDujw Drmswlw cl AwveI
transliteration: Maanasar Hans Saadhasangati Paramahansa , Dharamadhujaa Dharamasaalaa Chal Aavaee ?
translation: Just as swans visit lake Mansarover, so do the righteous people with divine wisdom visit the holy congregation of Lord's loving servants/devotees.

gurmukhi: auq mukqwhl Ahwr duqIAw nwsiq ieq gur sbd suriq ilv lwvhI
transliteration: Out Moukataahal Ahaar Douteeaa Naasati , It Gur Sabad Surati Liv Laavahee ?
translation: There, at Mansarover, the swans relish pearls as their food and nothing else; so do these devotees engross their minds in the holy Naam of the Lord and remains attached with His divine words.

gurmukhi: auq KIr nIr inrvwro kY bKwnIAq ieq gurmiq durmiq smJwvhI
transliteration: Out Kheer Neer Niravaaro Kai Bakhaaneeata , It Gurmati Duramati Samajhaavahee ?
translation: The swans are believed to disintegrate milk in its constituents of water and milk; while here in the holy congregation, one learns about those who are Guru-oriented and self-oriented.

gurmukhi: auq bg hMs bMs duibDw n myit skY ieq kwg pwig sm rUp kY imlwvhI ]340]
transliteration: Out Bag Hans Bans Doubidhaa N Mayti Sakai , It Kaag Paagi Sam Roop Kai Milaavahee ?340?
translation: The temperament of herons cannot be changed into those of swans but here in the holy congregation, those who are like filth-eating crows are transformed into holy and devoted persons through the hue of Naam blessed by the True Guru. (340)
